item.description:
Trip's Coordinator(TC): Anne catwoman@mosaicmass.org

EVENT: Join this annual tradition, sponsored by MIT Hillel, in which the best and
brightest of MIT professors earnestly debate the superiority of the latke and the hamentaschen. Decide for yourself, sampling both after the debate.
This event is a hoot and is always standing room only! RSVP so we can save seats and sit together. To quote one MOSAIC participant who attended last year, “The annual MIT Latke Hamentashen Debate is an event not to be missed. A favorite of NASCAR and World Wrestling enthusiasts, as well as proponents of String Theory and the Elegant Universe - yes, folks, there's something for everyone.

There's nothing like watching an assemblage of the greatest scientific minds on the planet debate the supremacy of the latke over the hamentashen, and vice versa. From genetics to geometry, robotics to poli-sci, Galileo to Einstein; from agony to ecstasy - the event is both illuminating and hilarious.

For all of those who missed it (you know who you are,) there's
always next year. So, for your chance to weigh in on the ultimate question -hamentashen or latke? - mark your calendars for March, 2009. I know I will!”
See the MIT web site for more information: http://events.mit.edu...

MEET: 7:30 p.m. in MIT Room 26-100. If you are not familiar with the MIT campus, check here for a map: http://whereis.mit.ed...

RSVP: Recommended by March 3 to the TC, Anne at her address provided above, Otherwise, you’re on your own!
COST: Event is free + $5 for non-members.
item.how_to_find_us: Contact the Trip's Coordinator (TC) for arrangements

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: LATKE - HAMANTASHEN DEBATE
